node.title: Paulette didn't want to leave her remote community, but a lack of NDIS support services meant she had no choice
node.alt: Paulette Bumarda (left) and her support worker Genevieve Agostinelli smile while sitting next to each other.
node.description: More than 1,700 NDIS participants live in remote parts of the Northern Territory, but advocates say many need to go far from home, and often have to relocate to the city,Â to get the support they need.
node.content:
["Paulette Bumarda was hesitant to move away from her home and family in the Arnhem Land community\u00a0of Gunbalanya to Darwin, but it was necessary.", "The 51-year-old suffers from a rare degenerative condition known as Machado-Joseph Disease and requires a carer to assist her with daily tasks.", "\"The carers from Darwin help me, [they] clean my house, wash me and wash my clothes,\" Ms Bumarda said.", "In Darwin, she can access a range of support services under her NDIS plan which were not available in Gunbalanya, including Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA) and multiple physiotherapy sessions per\u00a0week.", "Her support worker, Genevieve Agostinelli, said the move has been beneficial for Ms Bumarda's health.", "\"For the last couple of years, Paulette has found it increasingly difficult to be living out there [in Gunbalanya] with the lack of support,\" Ms Agostinelli said.", "", "
Gunbalanya is about 300 kilomtres east of Darwin.(Alice Plate: ABC Local)
", "It took about a year for Ms Bumarda to relocate to Darwin, but just two months since she left Gunbalanya, she is feeling homesick.", "\"It's really hard for me to stay [in Darwin] without my family,\" she said.", "More than 1,700 NDIS participants live in remote parts of the Northern Territory, but advocates say many like Ms Bumarda struggle to access adequate support, forcing them to relocate to the city.", "
Accessibility issues
", "The peak body for disability service organisations, National Disability Services (NDS), said remote providers face significant barriers, including difficulties in building a stable workforce.", "\"That can come down to staff retention and challenging working environments,\" said Nadia Lindop, Deputy Chair of the NDS NT Committee and CEO of the Machado-Joseph Disease Foundation.", "Ms Lindop said pricing levels under the NDIS for remote services were\u00a0inadequate, posing a further challenge for providers.", "\"Even though there's a 25 per cent increase or loading on prices for remote [services], it doesn't actually reflect the real cost of doing business in remote communities,\" she said.", "\"Because of the low numbers of participants with NDIS plans in these remote communities, you don't have the same flexibility around a diverse workforce that you may have in an urban setting.\"", "She said participants' plans were\u00a0also being slashed, affecting the delivery of services.", "\"We're seeing plans cut 10\u00a0per cent here, 20 per cent there,\" she said.", "\"Where organisations are looking at how we can invest [in remote communities], it's extremely hard to put a business case to your board to justify investing when we're seeing plans eroded.\"", "After spending five years living in Ramingining, NDIS participant Jason Motbey said he had no choice but to leave his job and move to Darwin due to the lack of support services available in the remote community.", "", "
Jason Motbey had to leave Raminging for Darwin to access the support he needs.(ABC News: Che Chorley)
", "Mr Motbey suffers from a rare spinal condition known as Brown Sequard Syndrome.", "He said while he was initially reluctant to relocate, his health was deteriorating in Ramingining.", "\"Here [in Darwin] I see an occupational therapist, a physiotherapist and massage therapist every single week. That just wasn't possible in Ramingining.,\" Mr Motbey said.", "\"I was getting more tired, I was getting less fit and I was having mental health issues as well.\"", "
Remote trials underway
", "The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA), which implements the NDIS, said it had previously introduced measures to try and improve remote service delivery.", "\"This includes increased price limits and loading for remote and very remote areas,\" an NDIA spokesperson said in a statement.", "The agency\u00a0said six trials were being conducted in remote parts of the Northern Territory to address \"market gaps\" \u2014 including in the Barkly, East Arnhem, West Arnhem and Tiwi Islands.", "The trials are expected to be completed in the coming months.", "The ABC understands the NDIA is evaluating the trials, with the outcome of the evaluation to be shared with state and territory disability ministers.", "", "
